intro: Bertolonia organensis, commonly known as the Organ Mountains lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces clusters of bell-shaped flowers. Due to its limited range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
